results.p: A sea is a large body of salty water. There are particular seas and the sea. The sea commonly refers to the World Ocean, the wider body of seawater.
The meaning of SEA is a great body of salt water that covers much of the earth; broadly : the waters of the earth as distinguished from the land and air.

results.t: SEA | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: a large area of salt water that is partly or completely surrounded by land, or the salt water that covers most of the surface of the earth.
A sea is a huge body of salt water, typically a part of the ocean that's near land. Much grander than a lake or river, a sea can appear open and endless ...

results.t: Sea Level | Vital Signs - Climate Change - NASA
results.p: Global sea levels are rising as a result of human-caused global warming, with recent rates being unprecedented over the past 2,500-plus years.
Oct 19, 2023 — A sea is defined as a portion of the ocean that is partly surrounded by land. Given that definition, there are about 50 seas around the world.
